file_content.text: You've done a great thing by depriving the Empire of smokescreen--both to soldiers and innocents alike.
Ardus Industries is no longer under Imperial control. Here's your smokescreen sample.
Your problem is over.
Wonderful! I'll start on the antitoxin immediately. I believe this sample will save those troopers' lives.
Who knows how many would've been lost if the Empire had deployed smokescreen on a planetary scale.
That's one question I'm glad to see unanswered.
We'll never know, thankfully.
Likewise. Be well.
Just doing what's right.
If only more people felt that way. Thank you... and be well.
If you were more assertive with rebellion commanders, maybe I wouldn't have to come to the rescue.
This was your fault.
Believe that if you wish, but I know I did everything I could. Now if you'll excuse me--be well.
The sooner you run the Empire out of Ardus Industries, the better our chances of avoiding a wide-scale smokescreen attack.
No improvement in the paralysis, doctor. Vitals are weakening.
Blast! Just when you think you've plumbed the depths of cruelty...
Master Jedi--Doctor Tan Kirin. Please, I can't get these military types to listen.
Major--Doctor Tan Kirin. Please, I can't get our local boys to listen.
You're that privateer, aren't you? Doctor Tan Kirin. Please, I can't get these military types to listen.
Doctor Tan Kirin. Please, I can't get these military types to listen.
The Empire's acquired a new weaponized toxin. I'm already treating a number of paralyzed troopers, and I'm afraid things will get much worse.
Tell me how they were paralyzed.
What happened to these men?
I presume these injuries were sustained in combat.
What happened to these men?
These casualties happened in action?
What happened to these men?
What exactly took these guys out?
What happened to these men?
Battlefield exposure to an agent called smokescreen.
For the Empire, cruelty is like breathing. They'll continue till someone stops them.
Twisted Imperial plots...
Agreed. In this case, it started with a battlefield test of a toxin called smokescreen.
I'll give you one shot--talk.
The situation is critical. These men are suffering from battlefield exposure to a toxin called smokescreen.
The Empire acquired it when they seized Ardus Industries. It's vile stuff--causes paralysis, nerve damage, and eventually, organ liquefaction.
Two troopers bled out already, and without a miracle cure the rest will too. Now imagine the Empire deploying smokescreen on a wide scale.
Is there some way to develop a counteragent?
You mentioned a miracle cure.
Eventually, yes, but the surest thing is to deprive the Empire of smokescreen altogether.
If the Republic controlled smokescreen, we could turn it on the Empire.
That toxin would benefit us.
I'm a doctor--I don't approve of using this poison on anyone. But depriving the Empire of it... absolutely.
Unfortunately these idiot commanders won't divert the resources to re-take Ardus Industries. Only more deaths will make them listen.
People die--deal with it.
Now you sound like those fools in command. I'm afraid only a major attack will make them deal with this.
Please, we have to secure those smokescreen stores.
If you'd liberate Ardus Industries, I'm sure even our overcautious commanders would swoop in and seize the facility.
Smokescreen will be in Republic hands soon enough.
Agreed--I'll liberate it.
I believe it's time to deprive the Empire of its new plaything.
Agreed--I'll liberate it.
The Empire's about to lose their little poison lab for good.
Agreed--I'll liberate it.
Get back to your patients, doc. Leave the lab to me.
Agreed--I'll liberate it.
Thank goodness. One other thing--if you can, bring back a sample of smokescreen toxin.
If it means taking the fight to the Empire, count me in anytime.
Any excuse to hurt the Empire.
Violence is the language of war, I suppose. One other thing--if you can, bring back a sample of smokescreen toxin.
I think I can develop an antitoxin to save these troopers before it's too late.
Just be prepared--this limited exposure won't be lethal, but you'll likely feel its effects.
I can't help. [Refuse Quest]
I see... Then I'm afraid these soldiers--and many others--are doomed.
Please, I have some very sick men to take care of.
Ardus Industries is no longer under Imperial control. You don't have to worry about smokescreen anymore.
Your Smokescreen problem is over.
Wonderful!
